Summary: Technical Support Towards the Development of a European Repair Score Index for Different Product Groups. Description: The service request involves technical support towards the development of a European repair score index for different product groups such as consumer electronics, light means of transport and small household appliances. The support includes independent assessments of the reparability of different products, to be carried out according to the repair score methodology that will be provided by the JRC. Description: Comprehensive service of exterior lighting (including energy consumption), renovation and maintenance (not including the cost of the energy consumed by these installations) of interior lighting and... The purpose of this contract is the comprehensive management and intelligent exterior public lighting, renovation and maintenance of interior lighting and electrical and thermal installations of municipal buildings and offices and ornamental fountains in the city of Huelva, and serve as an operational tool for the pursuit of the objectives of energy efficiency, operational improvement, digitalization and innovation marked by municipal strategies (Urban Agenda, Municipal Plan against Climate Change and Innovation Master Plan, through the objective of carbon neutrality). The ultimate goal of the contract is to structure the actions to implement the development of energy strategies framed in the Innovation Master Plan of the Huelva City Council 2024-2027. Based on this plan, the Huelva City Council is committed to innovation as an essential factor to accelerate its urban development under the triple logic of economic, social and environmental sustainability. Furthermore, it aims to adopt an exemplary leadership role in the field of innovation, seeking a notable evolution in the way of providing public services. Comprehensive service of outdoor lighting (including energy consumption), renovation and maintenance (not including the cost of the energy consumed by these installations) of interior lighting and electrical and thermal installations of municipal buildings and ornamental fountains. input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: THYSSEN BORNEMISZA COLLECTION FOUNDATION. Summary: Hiring the Public Rental Service of Audio Guides and other Devices for Visiting the Thyssen-Bornemisza National Museum. Description: Provision of service to the Thyssen-Bornemisza Collection Foundation of audio guides, group guide system and other accessible mobile devices; all of them, resources that serve as support and complement to the visit to the Museum. The implementation of audio guides in the museum is essential to enrich the visitor experience and meet the founding purposes. This service provides a detailed and accessible narrative, complementing the information from the physical exhibits. However, the museum lacks specialized equipment and personnel to provide this service directly. For this reason, like many other public museums of our category and quality, we have relied on concessionaires for their provision. Audio guides, whether through the rental of devices or digital solutions, not only improve the educational quality of the museum and publicize our collections, but also promote accessibility and enjoyment for a diverse audience. This service is essential to manage the flow of visitors and enrich their experience at the museum.<br> Doc Title: Contracting of the public rental service of audio guides and other devices for the visit to the Thyssen-Bornemisza National Museum<br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-01. Closing Date: 2026-01-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: THYSSEN BORNEMISZA COLLECTION FOUNDATION
output.Summary: Hiring the Public Rental Service of Audio Guides and other Devices for Visiting the Thyssen-Bornemisza National Museum

The implementation of audio guides in the museum is essential to enrich the visitor experience and meet the founding purposes. This service provides a detailed and accessible narrative, complementing the information from the physical exhibits. Summary: Ec 2026 3 Service to Develop and Implement an Advanced Technological Solution to Improve the Management of Road Infrastructure and Traffic of the Interurban Road Network Entering and Exiting.... Description: EC 2026 3 Service to develop and implement an advanced technological solution to improve the management of road infrastructure and traffic in the interurban road network entering and leaving the city of Barcelona.<br> Description of the provision: Service to develop and implement a advanced technological solution to improve the management of road infrastructures and the traffic of the interurban road network entering and leaving the city of Barcelona. Description: The purpose of this contract is to regulate the conditions for carrying out a technical advisory service for the regional planning of public policies regarding active aging and dependency prevention. Said Service Will Include An investigation that provides a diagnosis of the situation of the elderly population of the Community of Madrid, regarding their social needs and level of political and social participation, as well as information on the resources that the entities Public and Private, Dedicate In Their Respective Territorial Areas to Elderly Care, Active Aging, Prevention of Dependency and the Fight Against Unwanted Loneliness in People Over 65 Years of Age. The conclusions of all this will be reflected in two Documents Proposals for the Next Active Aging Plan, As Well as for the Rationalization of the Internal Management of the Plan. Said Advice Will Be Oriented to the Development of the New Plan for Active Aging and Prevention of Dependency (2027/2023), As Well As The Monitoring And Evaluation Of The Measures Contained Therein.. input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: FAMILY, YOUTH AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS COUNSELING. Summary: The Purpose of This Contract is to Regulate the Conditions for Carrying out a Technical Advisory Service for Regional Planning of Public Policies on Aging.... Description: The purpose of this contract is to regulate the conditions for carrying out a technical advisory service for the regional planning of public policies regarding active aging and dependency prevention. Said Service Will Include An Investigation That Provides A Diagnosis On The Situation Of The Elderly Population Of The Community Of Madrid, Regarding Their Social Needs And Level Of Political And Social Participation, As Well As Information On The Resources That Public And Private Entities Allocate In Their Respective Territorial Areas To Elderly Care, Active Aging, Prevention Of Dependency And The Fight Against Unwanted Loneliness In Elderly 65 Years. The conclusions of all this will be reflected in two proposed documents for the next active aging plan, as well as for the rationalization of the internal management of the plan. Said advice will be aimed at the preparation of the new plan for active aging and dependency prevention (2027/2023), as well as the monitoring and evaluation of the measures contained therein.. Published Date: 2025-11-03. Closing Date: 2025-11-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: FAMILY, YOUTH AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS COUNSELING
output.Summary: The Purpose of This Contract is to Regulate the Conditions for Carrying out a Technical Advisory Service for Regional Planning of Public Policies on Aging...
output.Description: The purpose of this contract is to regulate the conditions for carrying out a technical advisory service for the regional planning of public policies regarding active aging and dependency prevention. Said Service Will Include An Investigation That Provides A Diagnosis On The Situation Of The Elderly Population Of The Community Of Madrid, Regarding Their Social Needs And Level Of Political And Social Participation, As Well As Information On The Resources That Public And Private Entities Allocate In Their Respective Territorial Areas To Elderly Care, Active Aging, Prevention Of Dependency And The Fight Against Unwanted Loneliness In Elderly 65 Years. The conclusions of all this will be reflected in two proposed documents for the next active aging plan, as well as for the rationalization of the internal management of the plan. Said advice will be aimed at the preparation of the new plan for active aging and dependency prevention (2027/2023), as well as the monitoring and evaluation of the measures contained therein.

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: FUNDACIÓN MIGUEL SERVET. Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement (Pcp) of Innovative and Sustainable Solutions to Treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - Theresa Pcp. Description: In preparation for the THERESA PCP, an Open Market Consultation (OMC) will be held between 22 December 2025 and 28 February 2026, aimed at engaging potential suppliers, research institutions and other stakeholders to inform and refine the procurement strategy and related functional and technical specifications. Activities foreseen include: Launch of the OMC (22 December 2025) with public announcement and registration; in January 2026, local and online events are planned in Spain, the Netherlands, Belgium, Estonia and Poland to present the project scope, requirements and PCP procedure; company pitch sessions; an online Request for Information (RFI) via EU Survey; a Q&A mechanism and matchmaking tool to support networking; bilateral meetings with suppliers; and a final event (26 February 2026) presenting results and next steps. All documents will be available in English. Any changes or updates to the OMC schedule, content, or documentation will be announced and published in a timely manner on the THERESA PCP project website: (www.theresa-pcp.eu/omc). <br> Doc Title: Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP) of innovative and sustainable solutions to treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - THERESA PCP <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-12-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: FUNDACIÓN MIGUEL SERVET
output.Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement (Pcp) of Innovative and Sustainable Solutions to Treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - Theresa Pcp

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: CONSORCI DE SALUT I D-ATENCIÓ SOCIAL DE CATALUNYA. Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement of an Innovative Systemic Sustainability Transition Solution for Health Care Organisations (Suhco). Description: Procurement will take the form of pre-commercial procurement (PCP), where R&D service contracts will be awarded in parallel to different R&D providers in a phased approach. This will allow alternative, competing solutions to be compared. Each selected operator will receive a framework contract covering three R&D phases. The three phases are: Solution design, prototype development, original development and validation and testing of a limited volume of the first products or services. After each phase, interim evaluations are conducted to select the best of the competing solutions. The contractors with the best value for money will be offered a specific contract for the next phase. The selected operators will retain ownership of the intellectual property rights (IPRs) they generate during the PCP and will be able to use them to exploit the full market potential of the solutions developed. All interested operators are invited to take part in the upcoming open market consultation (regardless of their geographic location , the size or governance structure of their organisation). The open market consultation will be organised in the form of a series of meetings. It will provide you with an overview of the procurement objectives, the PCP process and the main clauses of the contract. You will also have the opportunity to ask questions. The first series of meetings will be held online or hybrid by each of the procurers mentioned under Section I.1). During those meetings, the procurers .... Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-12-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through on-line surveys, focus group discussions, semi-structured in-depth interview and online experiments that will inform the implementation of actions that make farming more attractive to young people both with and without farming background. The Commission will prepare draft version of all materials to be used in the data collection (questionnaires, discussion guides, and experimental designs). The contractor shall provide suggestions for improvement; program the surveys and experiments in their on-line survey platform of choice; recruit participants, assure completion of the tasks by the selected sample sizes meeting data quality, provide digital versions of the data; and report on data characteristics together with lessons learnt during the process. <br> Doc Title: Generational renewal in agriculture - exploring which characteristics could increase youth demand for farming <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-10-01. Closing Date: 2025-10-10. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through on-line surveys, focus group discussions, semi-structured in-depth interview and online experiments that will inform the implementation of actions that make farming more attractive to young people both with and without farming background. The Commission will prepare draft version of all materials to be used in the data collection (questionnaires, discussion guides, and experimental designs). The contractor shall provide suggestions for improvement; program the surveys and experiments in their on-line survey platform of choice; recruit participants, assure completion of the tasks by the selected sample sizes meeting data quality, provide digital versions of the data; and report on data characteristics together with lessons learnt during the process. <br> Doc Title: Generational renewal in agriculture - exploring which characteristics could increase youth demand for farming <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-08-25. Closing Date: 2025-09-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming

Description: Integral supply of equipment and materials, engineering, assembly and commissioning of an experimental synthetic fuel platform sustainable from syngas and green hydrogen in C ...<br> The Cubillos del Sil Technology Development Center of the City of Energy Foundation - CIUDEN F.S.P., requires an experimental platform for the production of sustainable synthetic fuels (CSS), such as SAF, biocarbons and other derivatives of green hydrogen and captured co₂. This need arises from the growing importance of chemical storage of energy "in the form of molecules ", also called chemical storage, in such a way that it is likely to be used at another posterior time. The platform will focus on CSS synthesis using fischer-trotpsch technology, using syngas generated from biomass, green hydrogen and co₂ biogenic. It will also allow advanced technological routes and hybridize with other energy storage systems already available in the center.<br> The solution must include the supply, installation and commissioning of all the necessary equipment and systems, integrating with the infrastructure existing, under criteria of energy efficiency, waste minimization and reuse of resources.<br> R&D projects in energy storage and energy efficiency of component 10: Fair transition of the PRTR, which contributes to the fulfillment of objective No. 142 of the Cid Annex.<br> In accordance with article 18 of the LCSP, in relation to the provisions of article 3 of the Directs .... input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through on-line surveys, focus group discussions, semi-structured in-depth interview and online experiments that will inform the implementation of actions that make farming more attractive to young people both with and without farming background. The Commission will prepare draft version of all materials to be used in the data collection (questionnaires, discussion guides, and experimental designs). The contractor shall provide suggestions for improvement; program the surveys and experiments in their on-line survey platform of choice; recruit participants, assure completion of the tasks by the selected sample sizes meeting data quality, provide digital versions of the data; and report on data characteristics together with lessons learnt during the process. <br> Doc Title: Generational renewal in agriculture - exploring which characteristics could increase youth demand for farming <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-07-24. Closing Date: 2025-09-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: MANAGEMENT OF TELECOM INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES. AND CERTIFICATION S.A.U.. Summary: Development of a Platform for Issuing Electronic Attributes.. Description: This hiring is aimed at the technical and computer development consulting services necessary for the creation of a platform for the issuance of electronic attributes statements in a digital identity portfolio that meets the technical requirements of the EUDI Wallet.<br> He Digital identity area of ​​ISTEC, as a qualified provider of trusted services and with access to authentic sources of information, is positioned as an entity capable of issuing credentials in accordance with the standards defined by EIDAS2. With this tender it is sought to reach the following goals:<br> - Issue verifiable credentials based on the authentic sources of information available. These credentials must be adjusted to the standards and requirements of EIDAS2, thus ensuring interoperability and cross -border recognition.<br> - Integrate the transmitter with infrastructure and established protocols, such as the use of EBSI to manage trust lists and integration with the sovereign portfolio of Spain, facilitating the interaction between different public and private services.<br> - Examine possible improvements and evolutions, such as the adoption by ISTEC of the role of Identity supplier for natural persons and legal entities.<br> - Select relevant credentials to be integrated as credentials verifiable in the digital identity ecosystem and elaborate the corresponding rules books for each of them. input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Generational Renewal in Agriculture - Exploring which Characteristics Could Increase Youth Demand for Farming. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through on-line surveys, focus group discussions, semi-structured in-depth interview and online experiments that will inform the implementation of actions that make farming more attractive to young people both with and without farming background. The Commission will prepare draft version of all materials to be used in the data collection (questionnaires, discussion guides, and experimental designs). The contractor shall provide suggestions for improvement; program the surveys and experiments in their on-line survey platform of choice; recruit participants, assure completion of the tasks by the selected sample sizes meeting data quality, provide digital versions of the data; and report on data characteristics together with lessons learnt during the process. <br> Doc Title: Generational renewal in agriculture - exploring which characteristics could increase youth demand for farming <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-05-06. Closing Date: 2025-06-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028. Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028 <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-04-07. Closing Date: 2025-04-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028
output.Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028 <br> Contract Type: services

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028. Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028 <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-03-19. Closing Date: 2025-04-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028
output.Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-2028 <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN AGENCY FOR SAFETY AND HEALTH AT WORK (EU-OSHA). Summary: Psychosocial Risks and Mental Health at Work: Facts and Figures. Description: The subject of this call for tenders is “Psychosocial risks and mental health at work: facts and figures". This project aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the state of play in terms of psychosocial risks and mental health at work in the EU, providing policy makers, social partners and the workplaces with better understanding of data and research evidence. The project-s aim is to present the main insights as well as gaps and limitations of the existing data, supporting preparations for EU-OSHA-s Healthy Workplaces Campaign “Together for mental health at work” (2026-28). <br> Doc Title: Psychosocial risks and mental health at work: facts and figures <br> Contract Type: services. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards. Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-02-13. Closing Date: 2025-03-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Data Collection, Validation & Harmonisation for the Eu Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards
output.Description: Since 2004, the Commission has produced the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards to analyse corporate R&D investment data and the positioning of EU-based companies compared to their global peers. The publication of the Scoreboard in December each year intends to raise awareness of the importance of R&D for businesses and to encourage firms to disclose information about their R&D investments and other intangible assets, provide economic analyses and inspire policy recommendations for Europe. The data for the Scoreboard come from companies- publicly available audited accounts. The main objective of this framework contract is data collection and validation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards 2025-28. The work shall be organised in annual cycles with regard to publication of the report each December. The approach is that, based on data provided by the Commission, the financial reports of up to 4000 firms shall be retrieved and several indicators should be gathered and validated for eligibility and accuracy. Moreover, this work involves cross-checking the data to establish a coherent and comprehensive final dataset, including occasional additional verifications after publication of the data in the Scoreboard report. <br> Doc Title: Data collection, validation & harmonisation for the EU Industrial R&D Investment Scoreboards <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: SERVICIO ANDALUZ DE SALUD. Summary: Research and Development Services and Related Consultancy Servicesopen Market Consultation of Procure4health for the Future Pre-Commercial Procurement of R&D Services Concerning the Preservation of Fr.... Description: Research and Development Services and Related Consultancy Servicesopen Market Consultation of Procure4health for the Future Pre-Commercial Procurement of R&D Services Concerning the Preservation of Fr... <br> RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT SERVICES AND RELATED CONSULTANCY SERVICESOPEN MARKET CONSULTATION OF PROCURE4HEALTH FOR THE FUTURE PRE-COMMERCIAL PROCUREMENT OF R&D SERVICES CONCERNING THE PRESERVATION OF FRESH BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES <br> This Prior Information Notice announces the Open Market Consultation conducted by the PROCURE4HEALTH project and provides information about a potential future Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP) of R&D services concerning the preservation of fresh biological samples. PROCURE4HEALTH aims to challenge the market to develop innovative solutions for advancing the preservation of biological samples for molecular biology studies. This initiative addresses the need for cost-efficient methods to preserve biological samples - ensuring the integrity and high yield of DNA, RNA, proteins, and metabolites - without requiring freezing and its associated infrastructure. These advancements are crucial for enhancing translational research, optimizing disease management, and improving patient outcomes in the context of precision medicine. PCP is an approach that allows public procurers to buy R&D from several competing suppliers in parallel, to compare alternative solution approaches, and to identify the best value-for-money solutions that the market can deliver to address their needs. It is split into three phases: solution design, prototype implementation, and validation and demonstration of the solutions. In PCP, there is a risk-benefit sharing under market conditions be.... Published Date: 2024-07-09. Closing Date: 2025-07-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Capacity Building and Experimentation for Innovation for Place-Based Transformation. Description: The aim of this contract is to develop and implement an integrated set of activities for equipping European practitioners and policy makers from EU and third countries associated to the programme Horizon Europe with the resources needed to design and implement innovation policies for place-based transformation in the frame of the “Innovation for place based transformation” initiative supported by the European Parliament, with the aim to: 1.Reinforce territorial capacities for transformative innovation policies by developing and delivering a Capacity Building programme; 2.Support a place-based transformative innovation policy experimentation arena, where territories can jointly engage into different thematic policy Experimentations Journeys, based around common challenges. To achieve these objectives the following activities are foreseen in the contract: •To design, develop and deliver a modular training and coaching package (capacity building) targeted to national, local and regional administrations, and their territorial stakeholders (business sector, academia and citizens representatives) from the EU and third countries associated to Horizon Europe. •To design and facilitate transformative innovation expertise and logistic for the support of a minimum 6 Experimentation Journeys (experimentation activities) to be proposed by the Joint Research Centre of the European Commission (EC-JRC) based on the analysis of the received expression of interest by participating territori.... Published Date: 2024-06-20. Closing Date: 2025-06-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Technical Support for the Development and Update of Euromod - Slovenia. Description: EUROMOD is a tax-benefit microsimulation model, which covers in a consistent manner the Member States of the European Union. The model allows to study the effects of taxes and social benefits on household incomes and work incentives for the population of each country and for the EU as a whole. EUROMOD is unique in its area as it features a great flexibility in the scope of its simulation and ensures cross-country consistency of the modelling approach and comparability of the results. The model has increasingly been used by the Commission services over the past few years, particularly so in the European Semester context. Additionally, the model represents a valuable research infrastructure for the academic community in the area of fiscal policy analysis, with highly cited research conducted using EUROMOD being published in top journals. The contracts are intended to provide the Commission with services that support the development and update of the microsimulation model EUROMOD for 7 country-specific modules: Slovenia (Lot 7) <br> Doc Title: TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND UPDATE OF EUROMOD - SLOVENIA <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2024-04-30. Closing Date: 2025-04-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Technical Support for the Development and Update of Euromod - Slovenia
output.Description: EUROMOD is a tax-benefit microsimulation model, which covers in a consistent manner the Member States of the European Union. The model allows to study the effects of taxes and social benefits on household incomes and work incentives for the population of each country and for the EU as a whole. EUROMOD is unique in its area as it features a great flexibility in the scope of its simulation and ensures cross-country consistency of the modelling approach and comparability of the results. The model has increasingly been used by the Commission services over the past few years, particularly so in the European Semester context. Additionally, the model represents a valuable research infrastructure for the academic community in the area of fiscal policy analysis, with highly cited research conducted using EUROMOD being published in top journals. The contracts are intended to provide the Commission with services that support the development and update of the microsimulation model EUROMOD for 7 country-specific modules: Slovenia (Lot 7) <br> Doc Title: TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND UPDATE OF EUROMOD - SLOVENIA <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Survey on Growers and Citizens- Preferences on Pest Management for Xylella Fastidiosa. Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through surveys to contribute the socioeconomic analysis of Xylella Fastidiosa (Xf) impacts and adoption of Integrated Pest Management (IPM). The survey will investigate the optimal combination of IPM measures from a supply (adoption by growers) and demand (societal valuation) point of view. Further, the survey will cover aspects related to attitudes and behaviours of the growers (e.g. innovativeness of the grower as well growers- preparedness to take environmental measures on the farm, including risk aversion, networking and knowledge sharing among growers.), aspects related to Xf (e.g. knowledge of the pest), and structural aspects of the farm. The target population of the survey will be EU growers and citizens. The survey must be done through CATI-WEB-CATI interviews for growers in the provinces of Córdoba, Jaén, and Alicante (Spain), and in the Apulia region in Italy. The survey for citizens will be implemented online, with citizens mainly from Andalusia, Comunidad Valenciana (Spain), and the Apulia region in Italy, but also from elsewhere in the two countries. <br> Doc Title: Survey on growers and citizens- preferences on pest management for Xylella Fastidiosa <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2024-03-19. Closing Date: 2025-03-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE
output.Summary: Survey on Growers and Citizens- Preferences on Pest Management for Xylella Fastidiosa
output.Description: This contract aims to collect primary data through surveys to contribute the socioeconomic analysis of Xylella Fastidiosa (Xf) impacts and adoption of Integrated Pest Management (IPM). The survey will investigate the optimal combination of IPM measures from a supply (adoption by growers) and demand (societal valuation) point of view. Further, the survey will cover aspects related to attitudes and behaviours of the growers (e.g. innovativeness of the grower as well growers- preparedness to take environmental measures on the farm, including risk aversion, networking and knowledge sharing among growers.), aspects related to Xf (e.g. knowledge of the pest), and structural aspects of the farm. The target population of the survey will be EU growers and citizens. The survey must be done through CATI-WEB-CATI interviews for growers in the provinces of Córdoba, Jaén, and Alicante (Spain), and in the Apulia region in Italy. The survey for citizens will be implemented online, with citizens mainly from Andalusia, Comunidad Valenciana (Spain), and the Apulia region in Italy, but also from elsewhere in the two countries. <br> Doc Title: Survey on growers and citizens- preferences on pest management for Xylella Fastidiosa <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG JRC - JOINT RESEARCH CENTRE. Summary: Survey on the Role of Vehicle Generated Data on the Functioning of Vehicle and Spare Parts Distribution Markets and the Provision of Repair and Maintenance Services. Description: The survey aims to gain insights into the functioning of the EU vehicle repair and maintenance services, including the spare parts distribution market, as well as the role of vehicle data and the uptake of connected vehicles in the repair market outlook. The survey will provide evidence and information relevant to a study carried out by JRC in order to support the evaluation of the functioning of the Motor Vehicle Block Exemption Regulation (EU) No 461/2010 ("MVBER"). This evaluation must be carried out by the Commission as part of the review process of the MVBER. This exercise is led by DG COMP, and the study is part of an AA signed between DG COMP and JRC in order to provided technical and economic analysis of the trends underpinning recent developments in the vehicle repair and maintenance services market. <br> Doc Title: Survey on the role of vehicle generated data on the functioning of vehicle and spare parts distribution markets and the provision of repair and maintenance services <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2024-03-08. Closing Date: 2025-03-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

Upon examination of the applications received the contracting authority will draw up a list of candidates or potential contractors who may be invited to reply to specific invitations to tender in the future. Each time a specific contract is to be concluded the contracting authority will send the specifications to all or some of the applicants on the list, selected on the basis of special criteria for the contract concerned. The list drawn up following this notice will be used solely for contracts whose estimated value is below the thresholds laid down in the relevant EU public procurement directives. Inclusion on a list of potential contractors does not guarantee in any way that the contracting authority will invite any contractor to tender for any contract.
